title: Area and Surface Area Workshop

steps.prompt: Compose a rectangular prism net and record its dimensions.
Shade faces to show how you will compute surface area.
Explain how the net proves your surface area calculation.

successCriteria: Learner computes and justifies area and surface area using a net.

title: Investigate Circle Formulas

steps.prompt: Draw two circles with different radii.
Estimate circumference using the measure tool.
Relate radius changes to area changes.

successCriteria: Learner uses circle tools and measurements to connect radius with circumference and area.

title: Rigid Motions Lab

steps.prompt: Translate the given polygon using arrow handles.
Rotate the shape around a vertex.
Reflect the shape across a line and compare.

successCriteria: Learner demonstrates congruence through translations, rotations, and reflections.

title: Pythagorean Theorem Lab

steps.prompt: Construct a right triangle on the grid.
Construct squares on each side of the triangle.
Compare the areas to justify the Pythagorean relationship.

successCriteria: Learner verifies the Pythagorean Theorem through area comparisons.
